group_1.textRight: Nayuta still hasn't come out of the museum yet,@has she?
I wonder if she found some hopeful information@about the professor?

group_1.textLeft: If so, we may have to wait a while longer.

group_1.textRight: ...Hey, Rabi.
Don't you think the rumors have quieted down@since we left for Kamihama?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, when we were last here,@the students reacted more harshly.
If it's as calm as it was yesterday,@she may be fine on her own.

group_1.textRight: I did it, Rabi!
Or rather, if you already knew,@you should have told me!

group_1.textLeft: Oh my, whatever could you mean?

group_1.textRight: There seems to be an associate professor@who studies folklore at a university in this town...
who happens to know Papa!!
Rabi, did you know about this?

group_1.textLeft: You can hardly expect me to be intimately familiar@with his social circle, can you?

group_1.textRight: Nayuta is going to find the professor@at this rate.
Don't you think you should tell her, Rabi?

group_1.textLeft: Aside from wasting all of Nayuta's efforts,@I will be the villain who hid the professor.

group_1.textRight: That is true...
If we don't explain the "possibility" we know to her,@we'll be backed into a corner...

group_1.textLeft: ...I would prefer we prepare our own place soon...

group_1.textRight: Prepare a meeting place?

group_1.textLeft: I will contact "The Cradle of the Earth"@and the "Professor",
and make arrangements for Nayuta@and the professor to meet in Kamihama.

group_1.textCenter: Now that I have an appointment, we can go.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, I've assisted Professor Satomi on several@occasions.
When I did fieldwork together with him,
I learned how to get into the mindset of the locals.
*Chuckle* I'm terribly sorry,@I'm doing all the talking here.

group_1.textRight: N-no, I am simply glad we were able to meet.
I was hoping for some information regarding Papa,@though...

group_1.textLeft: I'm not sure I would be able to help you...
I've been trying to contact people@who had a connection with Professor Satomi,
but no one has heard from him...

group_1.textRight: I see...
Um, do you happen to know the inn@that Papa was staying in...?

group_1.textLeft: Oh, now that you mention itー

group_1.textRight: You know!?

group_1.textLeft: I must be getting old, it completely slipped my mind.
Whenever Professor Satomi came to Yukuni,@he would always stay at the same inn.

group_1.textRight: Truly!?

group_1.textLeft: I believe it was a guesthouse called@"The Cradle of the Earth".
I have the contact number,@so you should try giving them a call.

group_1.textRight: Thank you so much!
Ahh...I am so glad I have not lost all traces...

group_1.textLeft: ...Rather than searching through books, it is@something that can only be found@through relationships with people.
For us to continue our research, it is important@to treasure our relationships with people.
If you are looking for Professor Satomi,@who especially valued working with others,
I don't think your path will ever be cut short.

group_1.textRight: We will always be connected...?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, I'm positive.
Ohh, no more tears now.

group_1.textRight: I'm sorry, I just suddenly feel so relieved...

group_1.textLeft: But if you are going to continue investigating@in this town, don't let your guard down yet.

group_1.textRight: Huh?

group_1.textLeft: Talk of Magical Girls are spread as rumors among@students.
It's like an awful urban legend.

group_1.textRight: Then what Rabi was telling me yesterday@was true...

group_1.textLeft: If you're already in the know, then be careful.@You're a Magical Girl too, right?

group_1.textRight: You realized that...?

group_1.textLeft: It's because of what Professor Satomi would say.
He wanted to somehow save his Magical Girl@daughter.
